Fachrul Razi Minta Maaf Soal Polemik Cadar dan Celana Cingkrang
05 Nov 2019, 11:37 by Fikri Arigi, Syailendra Persada
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - Menteri Agama Fachrul Razi meminta maaf atas pernyataannya terkait cadar dan celana cingkrang yang menimbulkan kontroversi dan kritik. Ia merasa sebetulnya tak ada yang salah, namun ia menduga pernyataan itu terlalu dini.
“Kalau itu menimbulkan beberapa gesekan-gesekan ya mohon maaf. Rasa-rasanya enggak ada yang salah rasanya. Mungkin saya mengangkatnya agak terlalu cepat,” kata Fachrul dalam pertemuan perkenalan dengan Komisi VIII, di Hotel Sultan, Jakarta, Selasa 5 November 2019.
Fachrul mengatakan ia sebenarnya hanya ingin meramaikan diskusi terkait radikalisme. Bukan hanya soal celana cingkrang dan cadar namun juga hal lain seperti khilafah. Sehingga bisa menjadi semacam sosialisasi saat nanti aturannya terbit.
“Sehingga gaungnya sudah duluan kita buat sehingga pada saat muncul aturan mudah-mudahan orang tak berkejut lagi,” kata dia.
Fachrul Razi sekali lagi menegaskan bahwa aturan ini hanya akan berlaku di lingkungan Kementerian Agama.

Fachrul Razi Apologizes on the Veil Polemic and Cingkrang Pants
05 Nov 2019, 11:37 by Fikri Arigi, Syailendra Persada
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - Minister of Religion Fachrul Razi apologized for his statement related to the veil and trousers that caused controversy and criticism. He felt there was actually nothing wrong, but he suspected the statement was too early.
"If that causes some friction, sorry, sorry. I feel nothing wrong. Maybe I picked it up a bit too fast, "Fachrul said in an introductory meeting with Commission VIII, at the Sultan Hotel, Jakarta, Tuesday, November 5, 2019.
Fachrul said he actually just wanted to enliven the discussion related to radicalism. It is not only a matter of trousers and veils, but also other things like the khilafah. So that it can become a kind of socialization when the rules are published.
"So we made the echo first so that when the rule arises, hopefully people will not be surprised anymore," he said.
Fachrul Razi once again emphasized that this regulation will only apply within the Ministry of Religion.
